poem:
**Echoes of Extremes**

In the pixelated fog,  
whispers wear whispers,  
stepping out in soft shoes,  
no longer owning the fringe.  
Streetlights echo old flames  
as keyboards clatter chaos,  
braided in the threads  
of what once hid its face.  
Here, in the ether,  
frictionless hate  
finds a home.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Monday briefing: How social media is mainstreaming far-right rhetoric Good morning. A few decades ago, it was pretty obvious who was in a far-right group. Maybe they had a skinhead, an 88 tattoo or were part of the National Front. Most likely, they knew as well as anyone that their own views were fringe. No more. Last year, people took to the streets in Southport, setting a mosque, a Citizen’s Advice Bureau and a police". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
